text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to show
you how to make a classic chocolate
ganache it's been very highly requested
for some reason I mean I think I know
why because it is so fancy it's a
chocolate pretty much a chocolate glaze
that you can use the top pretty much
anything cupcakes
you know muffins cakes cookies you name
it it's very fancy you know usually when
you get a fancy cake from a fancy bakery
you see a nice glossy finish on top and
it's just chocolate ganache it's very
simple to make it so I'm really excited
to show you to you guys are you gonna
need is just a few ingredients which are
semi-sweet chocolate chips heavy cream a
touch of salt and a teaspoon of unsalted
butter how easy is that so first thing
you wanna do is get your cream and I'm
going to bring it to the stove and heat
it up just below boiling point just to
get it nice and hot right before I boils
but you don't want it to boil so I'm
gonna go do that
I mean you're right back here now all
I'm gonna do is pour my hot heavy cream
over my chocolate chips just like that
and just swirl it around to make sure
the cream is coating the chocolate chips
and then I'm just gonna let that sit for
a couple minutes don't touch it don't
think about it pretend it's not there
for a couple of minutes and then I'll
show you what it looks like let me put
it together now after a few minutes I'm
just gonna take a whisk and I'm just
gonna whisk this together and the hot
every cream is well melts the chocolate
which means which does a couple things
it doesn't overcook the chocolate which
can burn and then be bitter and then
it's a mess and just so that makes it
the most look at this consistency this
is what you get because it's perfectly
tempered if it's too hot it can't like
seizes up and doesn't blend like that
and if it's too cold
well you gotta put in the microwave
gonna do it all over again and that's a
mess now to Gary that glossy glossy
finish you need to add a little bit of
butter and then to bring the flavors to
life you're gonna put a pinch of salt
just a tiny bit of butter and you don't
want the peel you don't say the wrapper
of the butter just whisk that in now the
more you let this sit
the you know it gets a little bit
thicker you know obviously because it's
cooling down which is perfect because
I'm just going to set this aside to
frost or I should say to see what's
together my French macaroons book which
